Definition.name: dasum

Documentation.firstline: Absolute sum, the 1 norm of a vector
Documentation.content: Absolute sum, the 1 norm of a vector.

param.name: x
param.desc: the column major matrix holding the vector

param.name: incx
param.desc: the increment for x, 1 in the case of an actual vector

param.name: skipped
param.desc: default is zero, the number of entries stepped over to get to the first entry

Documentation.return: the sum of the absolute values

Signature.name: dasum
Signature.param: (Types.dimension_t m, Types.matrix_t x, Types.dimension_t incx, Types.dimension_t skipped=0)

Definition.Signature: Types.value_t dasum(Types.dimension_t m, Types.matrix_t x, Types.dimension_t incx, Types.dimension_t skipped=0)

Definition.name: daxpy

param.name: X
param.desc: the column major matrix holding the vector X

param.name: incX
param.desc: the increment or stride for the vector

param.name: Y
param.desc: the column major matrix holding the vector Y

param.name: incY
param.desc: the increment or stride of Y

param.name: x_skipped
param.desc: number of entries skipped to get to the first X

param.name: y_skipped
param.desc: number of entries skipped to get to the first Y

Signature.name: daxpy
Signature.param: (Types.dimension_t N, Types.value_t alpha, Types.matrix_t X, Types.dimension_t incX, Types.matrix_t Y, Types.dimension_t incY, Types.dimension_t x_skipped=0, Types.dimension_t y_skipped=0)

Definition.Signature: Types.matrix_t daxpy(Types.dimension_t N, Types.value_t alpha, Types.matrix_t X, Types.dimension_t incX, Types.matrix_t Y, Types.dimension_t incY, Types.dimension_t x_skipped=0, Types.dimension_t y_skipped=0)

Definition.name: dgemm

Documentation.firstline: alpha*op(A) op(B) + beta*C where op() is transpose
Documentation.content: alpha*op(A) op(B) + beta*C where op() is transpose

param.name: transposeA
param.desc: true when transpose of A is used

param.name: transposeB
param.desc: true when transpose of B is used

param.name: K
param.desc: number of columns/rows for the multiplier/multiplicand

Signature.name: dgemm
Signature.param: (BOOLEAN transposeA, BOOLEAN transposeB, Types.dimension_t M, Types.dimension_t N, Types.dimension_t K, Types.value_t alpha, Types.matrix_t A, Types.matrix_t B, Types.value_t beta=0.0, Types.matrix_t C=[])

Definition.Signature: Types.matrix_t dgemm(BOOLEAN transposeA, BOOLEAN transposeB, Types.dimension_t M, Types.dimension_t N, Types.dimension_t K, Types.value_t alpha, Types.matrix_t A, Types.matrix_t B, Types.value_t beta=0.0, Types.matrix_t C=[])

Definition.name: dgetf2

Documentation.firstline: Compute LU Factorization of matrix A
Documentation.content: Compute LU Factorization of matrix A.
Documentation.return: composite matrix of factors, lower triangle has an implied diagonal of ones. Upper triangle has the diagonal of the composite.

Definition.Signature: Types.matrix_t dgetf2(Types.dimension_t m, Types.dimension_t n, Types.matrix_t a)

Definition.name: dpotf2

Documentation.firstline: DPOTF2 computes the Cholesky factorization of a real symmetric positive definite matrix A
Documentation.content: DPOTF2 computes the Cholesky factorization of a real symmetric positive definite matrix A. The factorization has the form A = U**T * U , if UPLO = 'U', or A = L * L**T, if UPLO = 'L', where U is an upper triangular matrix and L is lower triangular. This is the unblocked version of the algorithm, calling Level 2 BLAS.

param.name: tri
param.desc: indicate whether upper or lower triangle is used

param.name: r
param.desc: number of rows/columns in the square matrix

Signature.name: dpotf2
Signature.param: (Types.Triangle tri, Types.dimension_t r, Types.matrix_t A, BOOLEAN clear=TRUE)

Definition.Signature: Types.matrix_t dpotf2(Types.Triangle tri, Types.dimension_t r, Types.matrix_t A, BOOLEAN clear=TRUE)

Definition.name: dscal

param.name: N
param.desc: number of elements in the vector

param.name: X
param.desc: the column major matrix holding the vector

param.name: incX
param.desc: the stride to get to the next element in the vector

param.name: skipped
param.desc: the number of elements skipped to get to the first element

Signature.name: dscal
Signature.param: (Types.dimension_t N, Types.value_t alpha, Types.matrix_t X, Types.dimension_t incX, Types.dimension_t skipped=0)

Definition.Signature: Types.matrix_t dscal(Types.dimension_t N, Types.value_t alpha, Types.matrix_t X, Types.dimension_t incX, Types.dimension_t skipped=0)

Definition.name: dsyrk

param.name: transposeA
param.desc: Transpose the A matrix to be NxK

param.name: K
param.desc: number of columns in the update matrix or transpose

param.name: A
param.desc: the update matrix, either NxK or KxN

param.name: clear
param.desc: clear the triangle that is not updated. BLAS assumes that symmetric matrices have only one of the triangles and this option lets you make that true.

Signature.name: dsyrk
Signature.param: (Types.Triangle tri, BOOLEAN transposeA, Types.dimension_t N, Types.dimension_t K, Types.value_t alpha, Types.matrix_t A, Types.value_t beta, Types.matrix_t C, BOOLEAN clear=FALSE)

Definition.Signature: Types.matrix_t dsyrk(Types.Triangle tri, BOOLEAN transposeA, Types.dimension_t N, Types.dimension_t K, Types.value_t alpha, Types.matrix_t A, Types.value_t beta, Types.matrix_t C, BOOLEAN clear=FALSE)

Definition.name: dtrsm

Documentation.content: Triangular matrix solver. op(A) X = alpha B or X op(A) = alpha B where op is Transpose, X and B is MxN

param.name: side
param.desc: side for A, Side.Ax is op(A) X = alpha B

param.name: tri
param.desc: Says whether A is Upper or Lower triangle

param.name: transposeA
param.desc: is op(A) the transpose of A

param.name: diag
param.desc: is the diagonal an implied unit diagonal or supplied

param.name: lda
param.desc: the leading dimension of the A matrix, either M or N

param.name: B
param.desc: the matrix of values for the solve

Documentation.return: the matrix of coefficients to get B.

Signature.name: dtrsm
Signature.param: (Types.Side side, Types.Triangle tri, BOOLEAN transposeA, Types.Diagonal diag, Types.dimension_t M, Types.dimension_t N, Types.dimension_t lda, Types.value_t alpha, Types.matrix_t A, Types.matrix_t B)

Definition.Signature: Types.matrix_t dtrsm(Types.Side side, Types.Triangle tri, BOOLEAN transposeA, Types.Diagonal diag, Types.dimension_t M, Types.dimension_t N, Types.dimension_t lda, Types.value_t alpha, Types.matrix_t A, Types.matrix_t B)

Documentation.firstline: Extract the diagonal of he matrix
Documentation.content: Extract the diagonal of he matrix

param.name: x
param.desc: matrix from which to extract the diagonal

Definition.Signature: Types.matrix_t extract_diag(Types.dimension_t m, Types.dimension_t n, Types.matrix_t x)

Definition.name: extract_tri

Documentation.firstline: Extract the upper or lower triangle
Documentation.content: Extract the upper or lower triangle. Diagonal can be actual or implied unit diagonal.

param.name: tri
param.desc: Upper or Lower specifier, Triangle.Lower or Triangle.Upper

param.name: a
param.desc: Matrix, usually a composite from factoring

Signature.param: (Types.dimension_t m, Types.dimension_t n, Types.Triangle tri, Types.Diagonal dt, Types.matrix_t a)

Documentation.firstline: The trace of the input matrix
Documentation.content: The trace of the input matrix
Documentation.return: the trace (sum of the diagonal entries)
